Description: Fragment of mouth, neck, body and handle of Corinthian black-figured pottery ring-aryballos ; on top of mouth frieze of dots between narrow black bands; dots on edge; horizontal strokes between narrow black bands down outside of handle; ring hole painted black; around ring hole, wide and narrow black bands with incision lines; around edge, black-figure decoration consisting of horse riders (only incision marks of horse's head and traces of black remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA183 and Ure Museum 26.2.3. The sherd is also published in Ure, P. ‘Ring Aryballoi’, Hesperia: The Journal of the American School of Classical Studies at Athens 15.1, January - March 1946, 41, pl. 10, no. 40.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 10, pl. VI, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.141) (Phase 1)
